org.jooby.aws

Class Aws

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jooby.aws.Aws
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Jooby.Module 

    public class Aws
extends Object
implements Jooby.Module

    aws module

    Small utility module that exposes AmazonWebServiceClient and give you access to aws credentials (access and secret keys).

    exposes

    • One ore more AmazonWebServiceClient

    usage

    application.conf: 
     aws.accessKey = AKIAIOSFODNN7EXAMPLE
 aws.secretKey =  wJalrXUtnFEMI/K7MDENG/bPxRfiCYEXAMPLEKEY
 
     {
   use(new Aws()
     .with(creds  -> new AmazonS3Client(creds))
     .with(creds  -> new AmazonSimpleEmailServiceClient(creds))
   );

   get("/", req  -> {
     AmazonS3 s3 = req.require(AmazonS3.class);
     // work with s3
   });
 }

    Keep in mind, you will need the s3 (ses, sqs,sns, etc..) jar in your classpath.

    This module is small and simple. All it does is bind amazon service instances in Guice. It also helps to bind utility classes like TransferManager. 

     {
   use(new Aws()
     .with(creds  -> new AmazonS3Client(creds))
     .doWith((AmazonS3Client s3)  -> new TransferManager(s3))
   );

   post("/", req  -> {
     TransferMananger tm = require(TransferManager.class);
   });
 }

    handling access and secret keys

    Keys are defined in .conf file. It is possible to use global or per service keys.

    Here is an example of global keys: 

      aws.accessKey = AKIAIOSFODNN7EXAMPLE
  aws.secretKey =  wJalrXUtnFEMI/K7MDENG/bPxRfiCYEXAMPLEKEY

  aws.s3.accessKey = S3IOSFODNN7S3EXAMPLE
  aws.s3.secretKey = s3alrXUtnFEMI/K7MDENG/bPxRfiCYEXAMPLEKEY
 
     {
   use(new Aws()
     .with(creds  -> new AmazonS3Client(creds)) // use aws.s3 keys
     .with(creds  -> new AmazonSimpleEmailServiceClient(creds)) // use global keys
   );

    The module also install the defaults aws credentials provider. Provider precedence is as follows:

    • application *.conf file (application.conf, application.prod.conf, etc...)
    • environment (EnvironmentVariableCredentialsProvider)
    • jvm system properties (SystemPropertiesCredentialsProvider)
    • aws configuration profile (ProfileCredentialsProvider)
    • ec2 (EC2ContainerCredentialsProviderWrapper)
    Since:
    0.7.0
    Author:
    edgar

      • doWith

        public <T extends com.amazonaws.AmazonWebServiceClient> Aws doWith(BiFunction<T,com.typesafe.config.Config,Object> callback)

         {
   use(new Aws()
     .with(creds  -> new AmazonS3Client(creds))

     .doWith((AmazonS3Client s3)  -> new TransferManager(s3))
   );

      • configure

        public void configure(Env env,
                      com.typesafe.config.Config config,
                      com.google.inject.Binder binder)
        Description copied from interface: Jooby.Module
        Configure and produces bindings for the underlying application. A module can optimize or customize a service by checking current the application env and/or the current application properties available from Config.
        Specified by:
        configure in interface  Jooby.Module
        Parameters:
        env - The current application's env. Not null.
        config - The current config object. Not null.
        binder - A guice binder. Not null.
